hook.text: Programming in binary was brutal. Humans needed a language closer to English.

buildup.text: Assembly replaced binary codes with short mnemonics like MOV, ADD, and JMP.

discovery.text: Each mnemonic mapped to one machine instruction. It was a thin but vital translation layer.

twist.text: Assembly was tied to specific hardware. Code for one machine was useless on another.

climax.text: Programmers gained readability but lost portability. The tradeoff shaped an entire era.

punchline.text: Readable to humans, still bound to machines.

quiz.question: What was a key limitation of assembly language?
options: It was tied to specific hardware
It was too slow to execute
